title: Write PRD prd011-blazes-templates: Template Schema, Discovery, and Selection
description:
deliverable_type: documentation
format_rule: prd-format

required_reading:
  - docs/VISION.yaml (implementation_phases phase 99.0 -- blazes mentioned as unscheduled deliverable)
  - docs/ARCHITECTURE.yaml (project_structure, design_decisions -- understand where blazes fits)
  - docs/specs/use-cases/rel99.0-uc001-blazes-templates.yaml (the use case this PRD must support)
  - docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel99.0.yaml (test cases S1-S21 that validate blazes discovery and selection)
  - docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-cupboard-core.yaml (Cupboard interface pattern to follow)
  - docs/specs/product-requirements/prd003-crumbs-interface.yaml (Crumb struct fields referenced in templates)
  - docs/specs/product-requirements/prd006-trails-interface.yaml (Trail creation and belongs_to links for future instantiation context)
  - docs/SPECIFICATIONS.yaml (prd_index and use_case_index -- understand how PRDs are indexed)

files:
  - path: docs/specs/product-requirements/prd011-blazes-templates.yaml
    action: create
    note: PRD defining the Blaze template schema, discovery mechanism, matching algorithm, and parameter extraction

required_sections:
  - "Problem: agents need reusable workflow patterns but currently construct workflows from scratch each time"
  - "Goals: G1 define the Blaze template YAML schema, G2 define the BlazeParameter schema, G3 specify template directory discovery, G4 specify template listing and metadata parsing, G5 specify task-to-template matching via tags, G6 specify template selection when multiple match, G7 specify parameter extraction and context inference, G8 document error handling for malformed templates and missing directories"
  - "Requirements: R1 Blaze Template Schema (file format, required and optional fields), R2 BlazeParameter Schema (name, description, type, default), R3 Template Directory Discovery (well-known path .crumbs/blazes/, configurable path), R4 Template Listing (enumerate .yaml/.yml files), R5 Metadata Parsing (extract name, description, tags, parameters without parsing full trail definition), R6 Tag-Based Matching (semantic match of task context against template tags), R7 Template Selection (single match, multiple match with specificity, user prompt for ties), R8 Parameter Extraction (required vs optional, type, default values, context inference), R9 Error Handling (missing directory, empty directory, malformed YAML, permission denied)"
  - "Non-Goals: trail instantiation from templates, parameter value binding and placeholder expansion, creating crumbs or trails from templates, template versioning or inheritance, remote template repositories, template creation or editing workflows"
  - "Acceptance Criteria: checkable outcomes for each requirement"

requirements:
  - id: R1
    text: "Define the Blaze template YAML schema with required fields (name, description, tags, parameters, trail_definition) and optional fields. The schema must be sufficient for the discovery and selection flow in rel99.0-uc001-blazes-templates without requiring instantiation support. Anchor to use case touchpoints T1-T4."
  - id: R2
    text: "Define the BlazeParameter schema with fields name (string, required), description (string, required), type (string: text, integer, boolean, list -- required), and default (any, optional). Anchor to use case success criteria S6 (agent extracts parameter definitions)."
  - id: R3
    text: "Specify template directory discovery: well-known path .crumbs/blazes/ relative to the cupboard data directory, configurable via Cupboard configuration or a dedicated setting. Anchor to use case flow F1 and test cases 'Discover template directory at well-known path' and 'Discover template directory at configured path'."
  - id: R4
    text: "Specify template listing: enumerate all .yaml and .yml files in the template directory, handling empty directories and missing directories gracefully. Anchor to use case flow F2 and test cases 'List all YAML files in template directory', 'Handle empty template directory', 'Handle missing template directory gracefully'."
  - id: R5
    text: "Specify metadata parsing: extract name, description, tags, and parameters from each template YAML file without parsing the full trail definition section. Malformed templates are skipped with a warning. Anchor to use case flow F3 and test cases 'Parse template metadata successfully', 'Parse template with minimal metadata', 'Skip malformed template with warning'."
  - id: R6
    text: "Specify tag-based matching: compare task context (description, labels, keywords) against template tags for semantic matching. Define what constitutes an exact match vs semantic match. Anchor to use case flow F4 and test cases 'Match task to template tags (exact match)', 'Match task to template tags (semantic match)', 'No match when no templates have relevant tags'."
  - id: R7
    text: "Specify template selection: when one template matches, select it; when multiple match, select by specificity (most matching tags); when equally specific, prompt user or use priority. Anchor to use case flow F5 and test cases 'Select single matching template', 'Select most specific template when multiple match', 'Prompt user when multiple templates match equally'."
  - id: R8
    text: "Specify parameter extraction: identify required parameters (no default) vs optional (has default), determine which can be inferred from the current task context, and which require user input. Anchor to use case flow F6-F7 and test cases 'Extract parameter definitions with all fields', 'Extract parameters with defaults', 'Identify parameters that can be inferred from context'."

design_decisions:
  - id: D1
    text: "Follow the existing PRD format established by prd001 through prd010. Use the same section structure: Problem, Goals, Requirements (numbered R1-RN with sub-items R1.1, R1.2), Non-Goals, Acceptance Criteria."
  - id: D2
    text: "The Blaze template schema is a YAML file format specification, not a Go struct definition. Go structs will be defined in a subsequent code task. The PRD specifies the contract."
  - id: D3
    text: "Template discovery and selection are read-only operations on the filesystem. They do not modify Cupboard state. The PRD must clearly separate discovery/selection (this PRD) from instantiation (future prd-blazes-instantiation)."
  - id: D4
    text: "Error handling follows the existing sentinel error pattern from prd001-cupboard-core R7. Define error types for template operations: ErrTemplateNotFound, ErrTemplateDirNotFound, ErrMalformedTemplate, ErrNoMatch."
  - id: D5
    text: "The PRD must be consistent with the existing use case rel99.0-uc001-blazes-templates and test suite test-rel99.0. Every use case success criterion (S1-S7) must map to at least one PRD requirement."

acceptance_criteria:
  - id: AC1
    text: "File docs/specs/product-requirements/prd011-blazes-templates.yaml exists and is valid YAML"
  - id: AC2
    text: "Problem section explains why agents need reusable workflow templates and why the current approach (constructing workflows from scratch) is insufficient"
  - id: AC3
    text: "Goals section lists G1-G8 covering template schema, parameter schema, discovery, listing, parsing, matching, selection, and error handling"
  - id: AC4
    text: "Requirements section has numbered requirements R1-R9+ with sub-items, each anchored to specific use case flows (F1-F7) and test cases from test-rel99.0"
  - id: AC5
    text: "Blaze template YAML schema is fully specified with field names, types, required/optional status, and an example template file"
  - id: AC6
    text: "BlazeParameter schema is fully specified with name, description, type, and default fields"
  - id: AC7
    text: "Non-Goals section explicitly excludes trail instantiation, parameter binding, template versioning, remote repositories, and template creation/editing"
  - id: AC8
    text: "Every use case success criterion (S1-S7 from rel99.0-uc001) maps to at least one PRD requirement"
  - id: AC9
    text: "Error types are defined following the sentinel error pattern from prd001-cupboard-core"
  - id: AC10
    text: "Acceptance criteria in the PRD are checkable and specific, not vague"

title: rel99.0-uc001: Create prd011-blazes-templates PRD for template schema, discovery, and selection
description:
deliverable_type: documentation
format_rule: prd-format

required_reading:
  - docs/specs/use-cases/rel99.0-uc001-blazes-templates.yaml (use case flow, touchpoints, success criteria)
  - docs/specs/test-suites/test-rel99.0.yaml (test cases for blazes -- discovery, parsing, matching, selection, parameters)
  - docs/ARCHITECTURE.yaml (project structure, component responsibilities, design decisions)
  - docs/specs/product-requirements/prd001-cupboard-core.yaml (PRD format reference -- follow the same structure)
  - docs/specs/product-requirements/prd004-properties-interface.yaml (PRD format reference -- similar entity-definition style)
  - docs/VISION.yaml (phase 99.0 deliverables mention blazes)

files:
  - path: docs/specs/product-requirements/prd011-blazes-templates.yaml
    action: create
    note: PRD for blazes template schema, discovery, matching, and selection

required_sections:
  - "Problem: agents need reusable workflow patterns but currently construct workflows from scratch every time"
  - "Goals: G1 define template YAML schema, G2 specify discovery mechanism, G3 specify parsing rules, G4 define matching algorithm, G5 define selection rules, G6 define parameter system"
  - "Requirements: numbered requirements covering schema (R1-R3), discovery (R4-R5), parsing (R6-R7), matching (R8-R9), selection (R10), parameters (R11-R12), error handling (R13)"
  - "Non-Goals: template instantiation (creating trails/crumbs from templates), template versioning, remote repositories, template creation/editing"
  - "Acceptance Criteria: checkable outcomes for each requirement group"

requirements:
  - id: R1
    text: |
      Define the blaze template YAML schema covering all fields referenced in
      rel99.0-uc001 flows F3 and F6 and test cases. The schema must include:
      name (string, required, unique identifier), description (string, required),
      tags (list of strings for semantic matching), parameters (list of parameter
      definitions with name, description, type, and optional default), and
      trail_definition (structure referencing crumb templates with names, states,
      and dependency relationships). Each field must have a type, whether it is
      required or optional, and validation rules. The schema section must follow
      the same tabular format used for entity structs in prd003-crumbs-interface
      R1.1 and prd008-stash-interface R1.1.
  - id: R2
    text: |
      Specify the template directory discovery mechanism per rel99.0-uc001 F1.
      The well-known path is .crumbs/blazes/ relative to the cupboard data
      directory. The path must also be configurable (via config.yaml or a
      Cupboard method). Requirements must specify: default path resolution,
      configuration override, behavior when directory does not exist (return
      empty list, no error), behavior when directory is not readable (return
      error). Specify template file enumeration: list all .yaml and .yml files
      in the directory, skip subdirectories, skip non-YAML files. Specify
      ordering: alphabetical by filename.
  - id: R3
    text: |
      Specify template parsing, matching, and selection rules per rel99.0-uc001
      F2-F5 and the test cases in test-rel99.0. Parsing: extract metadata fields
      without fully parsing trail_definition (lazy parsing for performance).
      Malformed templates must be skipped with a warning, not halt enumeration.
      Matching: compare task context tags against template tags; define exact
      match (tag appears in both sets) and semantic match (substring or synonym).
      Selection: when one template matches, select it; when multiple match,
      select the most specific (highest tag overlap count); when tied, prompt
      user. Define the parameter system per rel99.0-uc001 F6: each parameter
      has name (string), description (string), type (string, integer, boolean,
      list), and optional default value. Parameters that can be inferred from
      context (e.g., file paths from working directory) should be marked as
      inferred. The PRD must define how inference works.
  - id: R4
    text: |
      Define error types for blazes operations. Follow the sentinel error
      pattern from prd001-cupboard-core R7. Errors must include:
      ErrTemplateNotFound, ErrTemplateParseFailed, ErrNoMatchingTemplate,
      ErrParameterRequired. All errors must be checkable with errors.Is.

design_decisions:
  - id: D1
    text: |
      Follow the existing PRD format precisely. Use the same YAML structure as
      prd001 through prd010: id, title, problem, goals, requirements (grouped
      by topic with R-prefixed IDs), non_goals, acceptance_criteria. Number all
      requirements sequentially within their groups.
  - id: D2
    text: |
      The template schema must be specified as a YAML structure with field-level
      documentation, consistent with how prd002-sqlite-backend R2 specifies
      JSONL formats and how prd003-crumbs-interface R1.1 specifies the Crumb
      struct fields. Use a table format showing field name, type, required/optional,
      and description.
  - id: D3
    text: |
      The PRD scope covers only discovery, parsing, matching, and selection --
      matching the scope of rel99.0-uc001-blazes-templates. Template instantiation
      (creating trails and crumbs from a selected template) is explicitly a
      non-goal, to be covered by a future prd-blazes-instantiation. This PRD
      is referenced in rel99.0-uc001 out_of_scope as "prd-blazes-schema".

acceptance_criteria:
  - id: AC1
    text: |
      PRD file exists at docs/specs/product-requirements/prd011-blazes-templates.yaml
      and follows prd-format with all required sections (problem, goals,
      requirements, non_goals, acceptance_criteria).
  - id: AC2
    text: |
      Template YAML schema is fully specified with a field table covering name,
      description, tags, parameters (with sub-fields name, description, type,
      default), and trail_definition. Every field has type, required/optional
      flag, and validation rules.
  - id: AC3
    text: |
      All 20 blazes test cases in test-rel99.0.yaml are traceable to at least
      one numbered requirement in the PRD. Specifically: directory discovery
      (4 test cases), file listing (2), parsing (3), matching (3), selection (3),
      parameters (3), presentation (2) each map to requirement groups.
  - id: AC4
    text: |
      Non-goals explicitly exclude template instantiation, template versioning,
      remote template repositories, and template creation/editing workflows --
      matching the out_of_scope list from rel99.0-uc001-blazes-templates.
